course_title: Topics in History and Text: Slave Revolts in North America
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
This course centers on the history of enslaved people, resistance, and revolt between the sixteenth and nineteenth centuries. By working closely with primary and secondary sources, we will learn about the history of slavery in North America while exploring how scholars work to reconstruct the lived experiences of enslaved people as well as make sense of their efforts to resist the circumstances of their enslavement. We will pay particular attention to the meaning of resistance in different contexts as well as 
the moments when enslaved people participated in violent uprisings.
course_description: The course demonstrates how literary, artistic, and/or cinematic texts, when understood in relation to the context of their production, can be used to study selected historical themes.
